newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa stocks end weak ahead of budget.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa stocks end weak ahead of budget.

text.p: South African industrial shares on Friday ended weak in quiet trade ahead of the budget and the futures close-out. Golds were softer on a weak bullion price.
Dealers said the market was likely to remain weak ahead of the budget on Wednesday.
The main feature of the day was a 400,000 share bookover on De Beers at 1250 GMT, but dealers said overall volumes were light.
The March futures contract close-out on March 17 is also set to add to any budget-inspired volatility next week.
The all-share index shed 22.3 points to 7,061.9 points, the industrial index lost 26.4 points to 8,251.6 points, and the golds index dropped 13.5 points to 1,416.6 points.
